intro: Pentacalia hillii, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, Pentacalia hillii is considered a rare and endangered species.
